SENT.plain: Cat eye syndrome is a rare developmental defect associated with duplication of chromosome 22q11
The patients demonstrate specific abnormalities of heart, kidney, and eye
Here we attempted to produce a model for this defect by expressing CECR1 adenosine deaminase, a gene duplicated in cat eye syndrome patients, in mice
The transgenic mice expressed CECR1 under the control of either beta-actin promoter for ubiquitous expression or myosin heavy chain for heart-specific expression
The transgenics expressing CECR1 in the heart demonstrated high rate of embryonic and neonatal lethality
The mice from all the lines examined showed enlargement of the heart
Abnormalities of the kidney and eye were also detected in mice expressing CECR1 under control of the actin promoter
